summary: Design and build a responsive website for Sanwariya Testing Lab LLP (electric cable, wire, and conductor testing lab) similar in style to robustsolutions.in, using HTML/CSS/JavaScript/PHP, including pages: Home, Services, Book a Test, and Contact Us, populated with provided business contact details.
architectural_notes: Tech stack requested: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and PHP (server-rendered or PHP-backed forms).
Site must be responsive for desktop and mobile.
Required pages: Home, Services, Book a Test, Contact Us.
Logo asset source updated: use the client-provided logo file (not a newly generated logotype) for site branding across pages.
Email sending is not required/available; implement test report distribution via on-site PDF download only (no Gmail/email workflow).

existing_features.title: Create a responsive multi-page website for “Sanwariya Testing Lab LLP” (electric cable, wire, and conductor testing lab) with the following top-level pages/routes: Home, Services, Book a Test, Contact Us.

Match the overall layout and interaction style to the reference site https://robustsolutions.in/ (similar information architecture, hero + sections structure, modern business look), without copying any brand assets; use English for all visible text.

Add consistent company identity and contact details across the site (header/footer and Contact Us page): SANWARIYA TESTING LAB LLP; Ground Floor, Plot No.-G1-548, RIICO industrial area, Sitapura, Jaipur, Rajasthan –302022; GSTIN: 08AFQFS6982Q1ZK; Email: sanwariyatestinglab@gmail.com; Phones: 8890074166, 7737031940.

Implement the Services page with clearly structured service offerings relevant to an electric cable/wire/conductor testing lab (grouped sections with short descriptions), plus a prominent CTA to “Book a Test”.

Build a “Book a Test” page containing a form to submit a testing request (at minimum: customer name, company (optional), phone, email (optional), test item type (cable/wire/conductor/other), standards/requirements (optional), message/details, and preferred date).
Build a “Contact Us” page containing a contact form (name, phone, email, message) that stores submissions in the backend canister, and show a clear success/failure message after submission.

Frontend: integrate the forms with the backend using React Query mutations/queries, including loading states, error handling, and basic spam protection UX (e.g., submit button disabled while pending).

Choose and apply one coherent visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, section styling) appropriate for an industrial testing laboratory brand, and enforce it consistently across all pages; do not use a blue-and-purple palette.
Add generated static brand visuals as local assets and use them on the site: a simple logotype and a wide hero/banner background suitable for the Home page.
Add support for using the user's provided company logo instead of the currently hard-coded generated logo, and use it consistently in the site header and footer.
Update the HTML metadata to use the user's logo as the site favicon (and related icon links where applicable).

Update the Home page hero section content (frontend/src/pages/Home.tsx) to display the following information prominently (matching line breaks/structure as separate lines or stacked text):
- "Welcome To SANWARIYA TESTING LAB LLP"
- "Wires | Cables | Conductors | Conduits"
- "IS/1SO/IEC 17025:2017 NABL Accredited"
- "ISO 9001:2015 Certified Testing Laboratory"
- "Recognized by: Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS)."
Keep existing hero calls-to-action (e.g., “Book a Test”, “View Services”) and the current overall hero layout/background styling intact, only replacing the headline/subheadline copy as needed.

Add the Google Maps link https://maps.app.goo.gl/KETasMvUVDqNtvUQA to the website and surface it in the primary contact areas (Contact Us page location card and the site footer contact section) as a clear external link.
Centralize the Google Maps URL in the shared company info module so it can be reused consistently across the site.

Add a client-side PDF download feature for test requests (no email sending): in the admin page at route `/internal/test-requests` (`frontend/src/pages/internal/TestRequestsList.tsx`), provide a per-row action to download a PDF file that contains a formatted “Test Request Report” for that specific request, using the existing request data already loaded in the table.
